quiz.title: Economics: Price Controls, Market Types, Costs, and Production

questions.question: A price ceiling below equilibrium causes:
questions.explanation: A price ceiling set below the equilibrium price creates excess demand (quantity demanded > quantity supplied), i.e., a shortage.

questions.question: Which market has homogeneous products?
questions.explanation: Perfect competition assumes identical (homogeneous) products across all sellers in the market.

questions.question: Fixed costs:
options: Are zero in the long run
questions.explanation: Fixed costs (e.g., rent, salaries of permanent staff) do not vary with the level of output in the short run.

questions.question: Law of variable proportions applies in the:
questions.explanation: The law of variable proportions (law of diminishing returns) operates in the short run when at least one factor of production is fixed.
